--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> The focusing dials on Heritrix are in synopsis:
> 
> - Scope (Domain, Host, Path, etc.)
> - Filters (Regex on URL, Regex on Content-Type, etc.).
> - Size of response, time to complete response.
> 
> Sounds like you want a 'classification dial' of some sort.  Can you 
> describe what this classifier would do?

 Thanks for your reply Stack. I dont think scope or filter dials are
sufficient to meet my purpose. 

 Here is a brief description of what I want to do,

 I want to build a crawl collection for a topic and hence I need to 
run a focused crawl instead of a normal crawl. I have trained the Bow
classifier to recognize pages relevant to the topic. Now I want to
hook up this trained classifier to  Heritrix in such a manner that
Heritrix consults this classifer before following any link. In short I
want to add a URL to frontier only if it belongs to the topic (if the
score returned by the classifier meets a minimum threshold value)  

Is there a way to accomplish above task?
please let me know if anything is still unclear or not properly
explained by me.

Best,
